0.context: Eiffel Tower TheDigitalArtist for Pixabay Among all the best places in Paris the first thing that pops into our head when talking about the city is the Eiffel Tower The Eiffel Tower is a lattice tower made of wrought iron and one of the most important place to see in Paris Built in 1889 it s not just the city s tallest structure but also a cultural icon for all of France In Effiel Tower visitors can explore three levels with restaurants and shops on the lower floors and breathtaking panoramic views from the top The Eiffel Tower is one of the top 10 places to visit in Paris This is a place where you can have a completely different experience Thus It is not only one of the topmost tourist attractions in the city Location Champ de Mars 5 Av Anatole France 75007 Paris FranceOpening hours to early September 9 am to 12 midnight and Rest of the year am to pmEntry fee Entry Fee to the Eiffel Tower for kids below 4 years is free Must Read Restaurants Near Eiffel Tower In Paris Europe Holiday Packages On TravelTriangle Magnificent Switzerland Holiday Package Rs Plan your trip today Book Now Magnificent Europe Tour Package Rs Get quotes from multiple travel experts Book Now France Switzerland Tour Package Rs Compare customize quotes before booking Book Now Scintillating Spain Portugal Tour Rs Have Questions Talk to our travel experts today Book Now 6 Country Europe Tour Package Rs Best prices guaranteed EMI option available Book Now See more at TRAVELTRIANGLE COM Visit Website
0.summary: The Eiffel Tower, built in 1889, is a cultural icon of France and the tallest structure in Paris. Visitors can explore three levels featuring restaurants, shops, and panoramic views. It's one of the top tourist attractions in Paris, located at Champ de Mars, 5 Av Anatole France, 75007 Paris, France. The tower is open from 9 am to midnight until early September, and from 9 am to 11 pm for the rest of the year. Entry is free for children below 4 years.

1.context: The Louvre Shutterstock Situated in the heart of the city the Louvre is the most visited and most popular art museum and gallery in the entire world It is also amongst the most beautiful places to visit in Paris in one day Spread over a sprawling hectares this museum nestled in the royal fort also called the Louvre The relics of the same are still visible in the basement area One of the most popular places to visit in Paris is a lavish and exotic museum divided into several sections These sections include Egyptian antiquities Oriental antiquities Islamic art Greek and Roman art and more from the medieval period Location 75001 Paris FranceOpening hours 9 am to 10 30 pm on Wednesday and Friday and the rest of the days from 9 am to 6 pm It is closed on Tuesday Entry fee
1.summary: The Louvre, located in the heart of Paris, is the world's most visited and popular art museum. It features sections on Egyptian, Oriental, Islamic, Greek, and Roman art, as well as medieval artifacts. The museum is open from 9 am to 10:30 pm on Wednesdays and Fridays, and from 9 am to 6 pm on other days, except Tuesday when it is closed.

2.context: Notre Dame Cathedral iankelsall1 for Pixabay Notre Dame is a famous and beautiful Roman Catholic cathedral It is one of the many places to visit in Paris The Gothic style architecture the amazing sculptures and the gargoyles fascinate every traveller Its beauty lies in its ruins and domed roof If you want to witness the beautiful architecture in Paris then this is the place to be Moreover it has a unique charm to itself which is simply hard to ignore No wonder the place one of the most visited places in Paris Local guides reminisce and impart tales about different points of interest Small shops and eateries in the neighbourhood see the heavy inflow of tourists just because of travellers piqued interest in the Cathedral Hence this place has a lot to offer so make sure that you are ready for a great experience at the Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris Location Cathedral of Paris 6 Parvis Place IIOpening hours 8 am to pmEntry fee None Suggested Read Paris On A Budget
2.summary: Notre Dame Cathedral, a famous Roman Catholic cathedral in Paris, is renowned for its Gothic architecture, sculptures, and gargoyles. It attracts many visitors with its unique charm and historical significance. Located at Cathedral of Paris, 6 Parvis Place, it is open from 8 am to 6:45 pm. Entry is free.

3.context: Arc De Triomphe Alexandre Prevot for Wikimedia Commons honour of the imperial army in the 19th century the Arch of Triumph is an excellent structure and one of the most famous places in Paris The amazing sculptures pillar carvings and engraved victory tales on the arc are the elements of beauty here The beauty of the place lies in its beautiful architecture It is guaranteed that you are sure to get mesmerized by the amazing architecture of the place Because of its beautiful architecture the place is so popular among tourists Throughout the year thousands of tourists visit the place Thus make sure that you check the place on your list Location Pl Charles de Gaulle 75008 ParisOpening hours April to September 10 am to 11 pm and October to March 10 am to pm It is closed on Monday Entry fee 8
3.summary: The Arc De Triomphe, built in honor of the 19th-century imperial army, is one of Paris' most famous landmarks. Known for its sculptures, pillar carvings, and engraved victory tales, it attracts thousands of tourists annually. Located at Place Charles de Gaulle, it is open from 10 am to 11 pm from April to September, and from 10 am to 10:30 pm from October to March, closed on Mondays. Entry fee is 8 Euros.

4.context: Montmartre Montmartre is a hillock located north of Paris and renowned for the Basilica and the bustling Square of Tertre This highland attracts a plethora of tourists This crossroad always has painters and sculptors creating fascinating creations inspired by their surroundings Montmartre has been an inspiration to many eminent artists such as Claude Monet Pablo Picasso Vincent van Gogh and Amedeo Modigliani in the past This is among the top 10 places to visit in Paris for all the art lovers out there If you wish to witness beautiful artwork in the city of Paris then this is the place to be Additionally you can witness the great artwork around the place Location Montmartre 75018 PariOpening hours May to September am to 8 pm and October to April 9 am to pmEntry fee None Charges need to be paid for audio and video guides Suggested Read Most Romantic Hotels In Paris
4.summary: Montmartre, a hillock in northern Paris, is famous for its Basilica and bustling Square of Tertre. This artistic hub has inspired notable artists like Claude Monet, Pablo Picasso, and Vincent van Gogh. Located at Montmartre, 75018 Paris, it is open from May to September from 8 am to 8 pm, and from October to April from 9 am to 6 pm. Entry is free, though audio and video guides have charges.

5.context: Palace Of Versailles Mirabella for Wikipedia Wondering what to see in Paris in 3 days Built as an emblem of French Supremacy the Palace of Versailles is one of the most popular world heritage and cool places to visit in Paris This gigantic and awesome structure boasts landscaped gardens exotic décor an amazing terrace and a charming display of artwork of the Renaissance era The Palace of Versailles is listed as a World Heritage Site for 30 years In addition it is one of the greatest achievements of French art The palace today contains over rooms each designed uniquely The magnificence of the palace is truly hard to ignore making it one of the destinations to your Paris trip in a itinerary Location Place d Armes 78000 VersaillesOpening hours 9 am to pmEntry fee or on the days of the Musical Fountains and Garden shows
5.summary: The Palace of Versailles, built as an emblem of French Supremacy, is a World Heritage Site and one of the most popular places in Paris. It features landscaped gardens, exotic decor, and Renaissance-era artwork. Located at Place d'Armes, 78000 Versailles, it is open from 9 am to 6:30 pm. Entry fee varies, especially on days of the Musical Fountains and Garden shows.

6.context: Palais Garnier Palais Garnier is an opera house in Paris formerly known as Salle des Capucines Often referred to as Opéra Garnier this was the chief centre of Paris Opera a famous group of opera artists in the city Presently it mainly stages mesmerising ballet shows The mesmerising and pretty wooden carvings paintings and artwork displayed in the main façade stairway stage fly tower grand foyer and pavilions make it a major Paris point of interest Thus this is one of the top 10 places to visit in Paris Location Pl de l Opéra 75009 ParisOpening hours 10 am to 4 30 pm from September to June and 10 am to pm from July to AugustEntry fee Suggested Read Temple Of Love Paris
6.summary: Palais Garnier, also known as Opéra Garnier, is a famous opera house in Paris, known for its stunning wooden carvings, paintings, and artwork. It mainly stages ballet shows. Located at Place de l'Opéra, 75009 Paris, it is open from 10 am to 4:30 pm from September to June, and from 10 am to 5:30 pm from July to August.

7.context: Quartier Latin Nestled on the bank of the Seine Quartier Latin tops the list of tourist attractions in Paris It houses many renowned educational institutions like Ecole des Mines de Paris Schola Cantorum Ecole Polytechnique and Ecole Normale Superieure Luxembourg Park is the private landscape garden surrounding the Senate House known for its picturesque fountains The garden also hosts many sports championships including the championship of France Tennis Location Latin Quarter Paris FranceOpening hours 7 am to 1 hour before sunset in summer and 8 am to 1 hour before sunset in winter Entry fee None
7.summary: Quartier Latin, located on the bank of the Seine, is a top tourist attraction in Paris. It is home to renowned educational institutions and Luxembourg Park, known for its picturesque fountains and sports championships. The park is open from 7 am to 1 hour before sunset in summer and from 8 am to 1 hour before sunset in winter. Entry is free.

8.context: Moulin Rouge As the birthplace of French Cancan Moulin Rouge is a vintage and classic cabaret venue located at the base of Montmartre highland Formerly a seat for courtship dance Moulin Rouge now is a nicely decorated and extravagant cabaret house And of course one of the most fascinating Paris tourist places The building sizzling music and romantic décor make it one of the best places to go in Paris at night Also if you re looking for unusual places to visit in Paris France this might top some of the travellers lists Location 82 Bd de Clichy 75018 ParisOpening hours 9 pm to 1 amEntry fee Suggested Read Honeymoon In Paris
8.summary: Moulin Rouge, located at the base of Montmartre, is a classic cabaret venue and the birthplace of the French Cancan. Known for its sizzling music and romantic decor, it is one of the best places to visit in Paris at night. Located at 82 Bd de Clichy, 75018 Paris, it is open from 9 pm to 1 am.

9.context: Disneyland bunzellisa For Pixabay A vibrant colourful cheerful and always bustling amusement park Disneyland is one of the immensely popular tourist destinations in Paris Disneyland in Paris is not only popular among kids but also among adults Originally known as Euro Disney Resort this is one of the most famous places to visit in Paris Disneyland is famous for super fun rides shows animated movies rallies and exciting moments of meeting your favourite characters From exploring the Disney arcade roaming in street vehicles discovering the Little Word to visiting the princess pavilion or clicking with favourite characters like Mickey or the list has it all If you are looking forward to spending a day with your kids in Paris then this is the place to be Location Bd de Parc 77700 CoupvrayOpening hours 10 am to 11 pmEntry fee A ticket for one day costs 00 for adults and 00 for kids Besides daily tickets there are annual passes and holiday packages
9.summary: Disneyland Paris is a vibrant and popular amusement park, loved by both kids and adults. Known for its fun rides, shows, and character meet-and-greets, it offers a full day of entertainment. Located at Bd de Parc, 77700 Coupvray, it is open from 10 am to 11 pm. One-day tickets cost around 100 Euros for adults and 90 Euros for kids, with options for annual passes and holiday packages.

10.context: Place De La Concorde Place de la Concorde is the largest square in France built in honour of King Louis XV s recovery This place referred to one of the popular points of interest in Paris Initially there was a statue of the king But later the statute replaced by a statute of freedom known as Liberté Presently the square surrounding the statue of the king is a bustling one decorated with fountains and other figures Location 75008 ParisOpening hours Throughout the dayEntry fee None Suggested Read Paris Nightlife
10.summary: Place de la Concorde is the largest square in France, built to honor King Louis XV's recovery. It features a statue of freedom known as Liberté, surrounded by fountains and other figures. Located at 75008 Paris, it is open throughout the day with no entry fee.

11.context: As a perfect and glorious example of architecture was the former residence of the king of France It is now a beautiful Chappelle with marvellous décor and display A restored national historic monument it is mostly visited by history enthusiasts and photographers and is considered one of the places to visit in Paris Today the place is one of the most popular places to visit in the city The Chappelle is known to house several Christian relics including Christ s thorn acquired by Saint Louis You can witness all of these precious possessions only at the Sainte Chapelle Location 10 Bd du Palais 75001 ParisOpening hours am to 6 pmEntry fee
11.summary: Sainte Chapelle, formerly the residence of the King of France, is now a beautiful chapel with marvelous decor and display. It houses several Christian relics, including Christ's thorn. Located at 10 Bd du Palais, 75001 Paris, it is open from 9 am to 6 pm.

12.context: Centre Pompidou Perched in the Beaubourg area Centre Georges Pompidou is a fascinating and complex structure designed with superb intelligence and expertise Also known as Pompidou Centre this building houses a library a museum and a centre for music and acoustic research It is also the venue for several renowned exhibitions in France organised every year The collection of vintage as well as contemporary art here is truly amazing Location Place 75004 ParisOpening hours 11 am to 10 pmEntry fee Suggested Read Bakeries In Paris
12.summary: Centre Pompidou, located in the Beaubourg area, is a fascinating complex housing a library, museum, and center for music and acoustic research. It hosts several renowned exhibitions annually. Located at Place Georges Pompidou, 75004 Paris, it is open from 11 am to 10 pm.

13.context: Musee D Orsay Musee d Orsay is one of the most popular museums in Paris displaying some magnificent artwork and sculptures Paintings of eminent artists like Berthe Morisot Jean Auguste Dominique Ingres Eugène Carrière Johan Barthold Jongkind etc are put up here for visitors The place is a hot favourite amongst art enthusiasts culture followers and history buffs Thus it is truly one of the most famous tourist places in Paris Location Esplanade Valéry Giscard d Estaing 75007 ParisOpening hours am to 6 pm on all days and till 9 pm on Thursday The place is called on Mondays Entry fee None
13.summary: Musee d'Orsay, one of Paris' most popular museums, displays magnificent artwork and sculptures by artists like Berthe Morisot, Jean Auguste Dominique Ingres, and Eugène Carrière. Located at Esplanade Valéry Giscard d'Estaing, 75007 Paris, it is open from 9:30 am to 6 pm daily, and until 9 pm on Thursdays. Closed on Mondays. Entry is free.

14.context: edmondlafoto for Pixabay Atop Montmartre the Basilica is a stunning tourist destination in Paris Reflecting features this Basilica has immense spiritual significance The portico arches and walls show off nationalist themes while the garden area for meditation and fountain are perfect for solemn serenity and mental peace The use of a camera is strictly banned inside the basilica Location Parvis du 35 rue du Chevalier de la Barre 75018 ParisOpening hours 6 am to pmEntry fee Suggested Read New Year In Paris
14.summary: The Basilica atop Montmartre is a stunning tourist destination in Paris with immense spiritual significance. It features nationalist themes and a garden for meditation and peace. Located at Parvis du 35 rue du Chevalier de la Barre, 75018 Paris, it is open from 6 am to 10:30 pm. Photography is strictly banned inside.

15.context: Tuileries Garden This is one of the most romantic places to visit in Paris Located next to the Louvre this is a beautiful place to visit in the city The majority of the visitors visit the garden to enjoy the afternoon sun while gazing at the French formal garden design The garden has a beautiful view which is going to calm your mind If you wish to spend some quality time with your loved ones then this is the place to be The garden also has a small amusement park which is a perfect spot for you to enjoy with your kids This place is ideal for travellers on vacation with their families When in Paris you must visit this wonderful place once Location Place de la Concorde 75001 ParisOpening hours 7 am to 9 pmEntry fee Free
15.summary: Tuileries Garden, located next to the Louvre, is one of the most romantic places in Paris. Visitors enjoy the afternoon sun and the French formal garden design. It also has a small amusement park, ideal for families. Located at Place de la Concorde, 75001 Paris, it is open from 7 am to 9 pm. Entry is free.

16.context: Musée De L Orangerie If you are an art lover then this is the ideal destination for you in the city of Paris This impressionist art gallery situated in the west corner of the Tuileries Garden The gallery is renowned for displaying the famous eight murals of water lilies by Monet Other than that you can also enjoy viewing other masterpieces by famous artists like Picasso and Renoir Art happens to be an important part of the French countryside and therefore there is every need for you to visit this beautiful art gallery Visiting Paris and not exploring any art gallery makes your trip an incomplete one So make sure that you squeeze in some time to visit this wonderful art gallery in Paris Location Jardin Tuileries 75001 Paris FranceOpening hours 9 am to 6 pmEntry Fee 9 Euros Suggested Read Beaches In Iceland
16.summary: Musée de l'Orangerie, located in the west corner of Tuileries Garden, is an ideal destination for art lovers in Paris. It is renowned for Monet's eight murals of water lilies and other masterpieces by Picasso and Renoir. Located at Jardin Tuileries, 75001 Paris, France, it is open from 9 am to 6 pm. Entry fee is 9 Euros.

17.context: Pantheon It is nestled in the dynamic Latin Quarter houses is a crypt that contains the tombs of famous French figures Tombs of Victor Hugo Marie Curie and Voltaire are contained at this place This is one of the most important places to visit in Paris By visiting this place you also get to explore the surroundings of the Latin Quarter Latin Quarter is a lively student neighbourhood which is mainly known for bookstores bistros and cheerful cafes You can explore all of these by visiting this place in Paris Location Paris FranceOpening am to pmEntry fee 5 for Adults 3 for Teenagers and free for Children
17.summary: The Pantheon, located in the dynamic Latin Quarter, houses the tombs of famous French figures such as Victor Hugo, Marie Curie, and Voltaire. It is an important place to visit in Paris. The Latin Quarter is known for its bookstores, bistros, and cafes. Located in Paris, it is open from 10 am to 6 pm. Entry fee is 5 Euros for adults, 3 Euros for teenagers, and free for children.

18.context: Jardin Du Luxembourg Located on the left bank of the River Seine Luxembourg Park is a beautiful place to visit in Paris The place has a charm of its own which never fails to impress its visitors If you are a sucker for beautiful views then this is the place to be The place is ideal for a family picnic The lush green surroundings of the place are the best way to take a break from the busy life of the city The serene beauty of the place is going to provide you with relief from the hustling and bustling city life If you wish to spend a nice cosy afternoon with your loved ones then you can very well visit this place Inside the park is the Palais du Luxembourg which too worth a visit Overall this is a great place to spend some quality time with your family Location 75006 Paris FranceOpening hours 7 am to one hour before sunsetEntry Fee None Suggested Read Paris Markets
18.summary: Jardin du Luxembourg, located on the left bank of the River Seine, is a beautiful park in Paris ideal for a family picnic. Its lush green surroundings offer a serene break from the busy city life. The park also houses the Palais du Luxembourg. Located at 75006 Paris, France, it is open from 7 am to one hour before sunset. Entry is free.

19.context: Saint Germain Des Pres This place is also located along the River Seine This Parisian neighbourhood is mainly known for its galleries upscale shops trendy cafes and restaurants The place has a lot of things to offer If you are to visit this place make sure that you spend a full day here You can explore a lot of things in the area You can enjoy a nice cosy time in one of the cafes or restaurants in the area after long hours of exploration Visitors should also be informed that the place is also famous for its thriving nightlife So if you want to have a memorable night in Paris then this is the place to be Thus this is one of the places in the city of Paris Location 3 place 75006 ParisOpening hours 9 am to 10 am 11 am to 5 pm and at 7 pm only on Sunday Entry Fee Free
19.summary: Saint Germain des Pres, located along the River Seine, is known for its galleries, upscale shops, trendy cafes, and restaurants. It offers a lot to explore, including a thriving nightlife. Located at 3 place, 75006 Paris, it is open from 9 am to 10 am, 11 am to 5 pm, and at 7 pm only on Sunday. Entry is free.

20.context: Musee Picasso If you are an art lover and have always been admiring the work of Picasso then Musee Picasso is a place in Paris for you The main attraction of the museum lies in the fact that it houses more than 5000 works along with tens of thousands of archive pieces All of these pieces are comprehended to demonstrate the creative process of the Spanish cubist master Pablo Picasso You can also explore the different artworks of the artist Starting from drawing to sculpture to engraving you can view it all here Musee Picasso has a unique collection of works of the great artist If you wish to see the whole works of Pablo Picasso then this is the place to be By visiting this place you also get to learn a lot about the artist as well Location 5 Rue de Thoringy 75003 Paris FranceOpening hours am to 6 pmEntry Fee 12 50 euros entry is free on the first Sunday of every month Suggested Read Lollapalooza Paris
20.summary: Musee Picasso, located at 5 Rue de Thorigny, 75003 Paris, houses over 5000 works and tens of thousands of archive pieces by Pablo Picasso. It showcases the creative process of the Spanish cubist master. The museum is open from 9:30 am to 6 pm. Entry fee is 12.50 Euros, and free on the first Sunday of every month.

21.context: Musee Rodin Musee Rodin is yet another museum in Paris This particular museum is dedicated to the French sculptor Auguste Rodin In the museum you can witness some of his extraordinary works including The Kiss The Thinker and The Gates of Hell This is a place where you are guaranteed to be amazed by the works of the great sculptor If you are someone who loves to appreciate art then this is the place for you You can explore plenty of great works in the museum Thus this is a good way to learn about the art of sculpting in Paris Location 77 Rue de Varenne 75007 Paris FranceOpening hours 10 am to pmEntry Fee 12 Euros
21.summary: Musee Rodin, located at 77 Rue de Varenne, 75007 Paris, is dedicated to French sculptor Auguste Rodin. It features works such as The Kiss, The Thinker, and The Gates of Hell. Open from 10 am to 5:45 pm, entry fee is 12 Euros. It's a must-visit for art lovers to appreciate Rodin's extraordinary works.

22.context: Le Marais This is a place where you can explore plenty of things The medieval streets of Le Marais are worth a visit The place is filled with unique small shops hip cafes trendy galleries and restaurants It can be said that this is a neighbourhood of great interest where you can have a great time with your loved ones This is a great place to add to the list of places to visit in Paris in 3 days Le Marais is known to have an reputation If you want to spend a cosy afternoon in Paris then this is the ideal destination for you So make sure that you don t skip out this place from your list Location Le Marais ParisOpening hours 24 hoursEntry Fee Free Suggested Read Boutique Hotels In Paris
22.summary: Le Marais, with its medieval streets, unique shops, hip cafes, trendy galleries, and restaurants, is a must-visit neighborhood in Paris. It offers a great place to spend a cozy afternoon with loved ones. Open 24 hours, entry is free.

23.context: Galeries Lafayette If you want to have the ultimate shopping experience in Paris then there is no other place that can be better than the Galeries Lafayette The spectacular galleries of Lafayette feel nothing less than a paradise for all shopping lovers Galeries Lafayette is perched in the posh Opera neighbourhood The grand department store is composed of three blocks of buildings and is renowned for featuring some of the top brands in France Here you can explore the shops of brands such as Hermes Chanel and Louis Vuitton Moreover you can also get other brands as well You can also visit the last floor to have a great view of the city In short this is a place which is worth visiting in the city of Paris If you want to have some luxury experience then this is the place to be Location Boulevard Haussmann Paris FranceOpening hours am to pmEntry Fee Free
23.summary: Galeries Lafayette, located in the posh Opera neighborhood, offers an ultimate shopping experience in Paris. Featuring top brands like Hermes, Chanel, and Louis Vuitton, it consists of three blocks of buildings. Visitors can also enjoy a great view of the city from the top floor. Located at Boulevard Haussmann, Paris, it is open from 9:30 am to 8:30 pm. Entry is free.

24.context: Catacombs Of Paris This is yet another destination to explore in Paris The significance of the place lies in the fact that it holds a huge collection of bones and ossuaries under the city The place was formed in the 18th century when the overpopulation of the cemeteries was a rising problem More than 6 million people were moved to the ossuary The place is worth visiting If you want to experience something unique on your trip then this is the place to visit Here you can witness whole underground tunnels and caves filled with bones and skulls This place is an ideal spot for all the adventure lovers that you must add to the list of places to visit in Paris in 2 days Location 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri 75014 Paris FranceOpening hours 10 pmEntry fee 29 for Adult and 5 for Child Suggested Read Paris In October
24.summary: The Catacombs of Paris, formed in the 18th century, hold a vast collection of bones and ossuaries under the city. Over 6 million people were moved to the ossuary. Located at 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri, 75014 Paris, it is open from 10 am to 8:30 pm. Entry fee is 29 Euros for adults and 5 Euros for children. It is an ideal spot for adventure lovers.

25.context: Seine River Amongst the most beautiful and popular places to visit in Paris the Seine River is the heart of Paris The river is 777 km long and is the major of water in the city While there s not much to do at the river there s a lot to see around the banks of the river Numerous famous monuments and buildings of the city including the Eiffel Tower Louvre Museum and Place de la Concorde can be found along the banks of the river Even today tourists and locals flock to both Rive Gauche and Rive Droite for various activities like sightseeing shopping dining or just to enjoy the vibrant atmosphere If you have just only one day this is the best place to visit in Paris in one day Location Seine River ParisOpening hours NAEntry fee Free
25.summary: The Seine River is one of the most beautiful and popular places in Paris. It runs 777 km and is the heart of the city. Many famous monuments, including the Eiffel Tower and Louvre Museum, are located along its banks. It offers sightseeing, shopping, dining, and a vibrant atmosphere. Entry is free.

26.context: Île De La Cité The very centre of Paris this island is one of the only two remaining isles in Paris This is the place where the original Parisian tribes founded the city There are only 981 residents in the area since only the northeast and western regions of the island are inhabited There are many canon houses in the area all developed in the 16th century There is a memorial here for the people who were deported from Vichy to Nazi concentration camps during Mémorial des Martyrs de la Déportation Location Île de la Cité 75004 ParisOpening hours 9 am to 1 pm Monday to Friday Entry fee 13 Suggested Read Villages In France
26.summary: Île de la Cité is the historic center of Paris and one of the only two remaining isles in the city. It is home to many 16th-century canon houses and a memorial for those deported to Nazi concentration camps. Located at Île de la Cité, 75004 Paris, it is open from 9 am to 1 pm, Monday to Friday. Entry fee is 13 Euros.

27.context: Musée This museum under the wing of Institut de France is privately curated in the 8th arrondissement of Paris Musee Jacquemart Andre museum has 5 parts and was designed by the famous French architect Henri Parent Before being turned into a museum it was the residence of Édouard André and his wife a famous society painter Nélie Jacquemart They collected famous art pieces their entire lives and put them up here for the world to see Thus this is one of the places to visit in Paris in one day for art lovers Location 158 Bd Haussmann 75008 ParisOpening hours 10 pm Be here at least 30 minutes before it shuts down Entry fee Between
27.summary: Musée Jacquemart-André, located at 158 Bd Haussmann, 75008 Paris, is a privately curated museum under the Institut de France. It was designed by Henri Parent and houses the art collection of Édouard André and Nélie Jacquemart. It is open from 10 am to 6 pm. Entry fee varies.

28.context: Le Manoir De Paris Do you like the idea of haunted houses Then you will love Le Manoir de Paris Spread around 1000m² it is one best places to visit in Paris at night The 30 artists who work here bring 14 Parisian legends to life most of which are based on facts The 23 rooms offer stories of horror told in 5 levels of fearfulness that visitors can choose from There are 3 animatronics a rabid dog and a garish gargoyle added to the fleet of horror objects Furthermore if you want to experience the thrill this place is one of the places in Paris Location 18 Rue de Paradis 75010 ParisOpening hours 6 pm to 10 pm Open only on weekends Entry fee Adults 10 to 15 years old and Fast Pass at Suggested Read Churches in Paris
28.summary: Le Manoir de Paris, located at 18 Rue de Paradis, 75010 Paris, is a haunted house spread over 1000m². It features 30 artists bringing 14 Parisian legends to life, with 23 rooms offering different levels of horror. It is open only on weekends from 6 pm to 10 pm. Entry fee varies for adults and children.

29.context: Louis Vuitton Foundation It is owned by the LVMH group The main aim of the Louis Vuitton Foundation is to promote art and culture With its incredible design and architecture it has become one of the places to visit in Paris Located in the heart of Paris on Mahatma Gandhi Avenue it is a place for those who have an interest in art and architecture The building s striking and unique design is a fusion of glass and steel which allows natural light to seep into the building Louis Vuttion Foundation s collection of contemporary and modern art is Futhermore the Foundation hosts many temporary exhibitions throughout the year showcasing the works of some of the most talented artists of our time Location 8 Av du Mahatma Gandhi 75116 ParisOpening hours 11 pmEntry fee 2
29.summary: Louis Vuitton Foundation, located at 8 Av du Mahatma Gandhi, 75116 Paris, is owned by the LVMH group and aims to promote art and culture. Known for its striking design of glass and steel, it houses a collection of contemporary and modern art and hosts temporary exhibitions throughout the year. Open from 11 am. Entry fee varies.

30.context: Pont Alexandre III Bridge Katka100 for Pixabay Touted as one of the most beautiful bridges in the entire world It connects and Les Invalides and its foundation stone was laid in 1896 It was built for the 1900 Exposition Universelle the fair that saw the introduction of radio escalators talking films and the world s most powerful microscope Pont Alexandre III Bridge named after the Russian Tsar Alexander III commemorates the alliance of Russia and France in 1892 Additionally the Tzar was quite loved in France since he could speak French as fluently as a native Location Cours la Reine Quai d Orsay 75008 ParisOpening hours fee Further Read Shopping In Paris So what are you waiting for Planning a trip to Paris is no longer a hassle for travellers all across the world Why not treat your wanderlust for a thrilling holiday to this dreamy city too and indulge in the finest experience that this French capital has to offer For our editorial codes of conduct and copyright 30.summary: Pont Alexandre III Bridge, considered one of the most beautiful bridges in the world, connects Les Invalides and its foundation stone was laid in 1896. It was built for the 1900 Exposition Universelle. The bridge commemorates the 1892 alliance between Russia and France, named after Russian Tsar Alexander III. Located at Cours la Reine, Quai d'Orsay, 75008 Paris, it is open throughout the day.
